intro: Dicalix heishanensis, commonly known as the Heishan dicalix, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptation to harsh environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species requiring conservation efforts.
